com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager

Class LogicalPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.LogicalPage

  • public class LogicalPage
extends Object
    Maybe better called a "DocumentSection" this represents a group of Renderables that logically belong on the same page, but may spill over multiple subsequent pages as necessary in order to fit. Headers and footers are tied to this Logical Page / Document Section.

      • putLine

        public LogicalPage putLine(float x1,
                           float y1,
                           float x2,
                           float y2,
                           LineStyle ls)
        Must draw from higher to lower. Thus y1 must be >= y2 (remember, higher y values are up).
        Parameters:
        x1 - first x-value
        y1 - first (upper) y-value
        x2 - second x-value
        y2 - second (lower or same) y-value

      • putCell

        public XyOffset putCell(float topLeftX,
                        float topLeftY,
                        Cell cell)
        You can draw a cell without a table (for a heading, or paragraph of same-format text, or whatever).

      • addTable

        public XyOffset addTable(TableBuilder tb)

      • putRow

        public float putRow(float initialX,
                    float origY,
                    Cell... cells)
             throws IOException
        Shows the given cells plus either a background or an outline as appropriate.
        Parameters:
        initialX - the left-most x-value.
        origY - the starting y-value
        cells - the Cells to display
        Returns:
        the final y-value
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing to the underlying stream.

      • putCellAsHeaderFooter

        public float putCellAsHeaderFooter(float x,
                                   float origY,
                                   Cell cell)
        For header or footer text on all pages in this logical page grouping.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-value on all pages.
        origY - the y-value on all pages (probably outside the normal margins)
        cell - the cell containing the styling and text to render.
        Returns:
        the bottom Y-value of the rendered cell (on all pages).
